title: Bug 49235: Unexpected output in ServletContainerInitializer onStartup method
description: Bug 49235: ServletContainerInitializer onStartup method returns unexpected output 'MySomeClass' instead of 'MySomeAnn'. The code works fine on Glassfish 3.0 but not on Tomcat 7.0.0.
OB: The output in the ServletContainerInitializer onStartup method is 'MySomeClass'.
EB: The expected output in the ServletContainerInitializer onStartup method is 'MySomeAnn'.
SR: To reproduce the issue:1. Build Tomcat 7.0.0 from SVN r939221.2. Use the following code:   @MySomeAnn   public class MySomeClass {...}   @HandlesTypes(MySomeAnn.class)   public class ModuleInitializer implements ServletContainerInitializer {       @Override       public void onStartup(Set<Class<?>> classSet, ServletContext ctx) throws ServletException {           for (Class<?> targetClass : classSet) {               System.out.println(targetClass.getName());           }       }   }3. Observe the output, which should be 'MySomeAnn' but is instead 'MySomeClass'.
